intro: Galium iranicum, commonly known as Persian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and garden geraniums. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Galium iranicum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to alpine environments.
